titleStmt.title: O. Willson et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG11189

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: The Undersigned Citizens of Bath, would respectfully represent, That at the March Term 1862. of the Bath Circuit Court, a fine was recovered against Thos R. Hill for $34,xx for standing a Jack without a License.

We further represent that said Hill is a good citizen and had no purpose of violating the law, beleiving that he had a right to procure the license at any time before the end of the year and actually did apply to the Clerk for the License but too late to be avilable -- March 20th 1862

O Willson S. B. C.
M Ewing
Daniel Harper
Alfred. N. Crook
N B Arnold
B F Trumbo
Travis Daniel
J. B. Colliver
Wm: Rice
Jas Morse
L. P. Kinsey
R. H. Conner clk Bath Co Court --
Jno D. Young I Know the facts to be as. stated.
V. B. Young
R. Gudgell.
This is all right. Mr Hill is one of the best Citizens and would not attempt to Evade the law. he was under the impression that if he got a license any time during the Year it would be all right.

Thos R. Hill
Petition for Remission of fine --
Bath Cir. Ct
$34. } Mis
Iss May 1. 1862
